meanings.definition: To remove the ashes from (a fire or fireplace).
meanings.sent1: She carefully deashes the fireplace after the fire has burned out.
meanings.sent2: He deashes the bonfire every morning to keep it clean.
meanings.sent3: The cat tries to help deashes the fireplace by batting at the ashes.
meanings.sent4: The wind deashes the trees of their autumn leaves, leaving a bare landscape.
meanings.sent5: After the volcanic eruption, the city had to deashes the streets to clear the debris.

meanings.sent1: The deashes of the campfire were scattered in the wind.
meanings.sent2: She performed the deashes of the fireplace with a small shovel.
meanings.sent3: The deashes from the barbecue were used as fertilizer for the garden.
meanings.sent4: The deashes of the incense filled the room with a sweet scent.
meanings.sent5: He collected the deashes from the fireplace to dispose of them properly.
